title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 12-2.6 - Abrasive blasting operations
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 12-2.6 - Abrasive blasting operations

State Regulations
(a) General. Abrasive blasting operations
creating dangerous air contaminants shall be enclosed as completely as
practicable and shall be provided with local exhaust systems to remove the air
contaminants. Exception:Outdoor abrasive cleaning operations where the
operator is furnished with and wears an approved air line respirator. (b) Operation. Approved air
respiratory protective equipment of the supplied air type shall be used by
persons employed in abrasive blasting rooms or tunnels. (c) Air supply. Air furnished to air line
respiratory equipment shall be clean. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
12-2.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
